intro: Pachypleuria dissecta, commonly known as the dissected pachypleura, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with finely divided lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture due to its delicate foliage and unique growth habit.
